intro: Govenia matudae, commonly known as the Matudas' govenia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, specifically Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Govenia matudae is primarily of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique morphological features.
